note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

Payload restrictions when operating short range flights can be minimized by dispatching in accordance with provisos as outlined in MEL for Main Tank Boost Pumps, Main Tank 1 and 4 Boost pumps with a minimum CWT Fuel of 17,000 lbs.

maintenance.title: MAIN TANK BOOST PUMPS MAIN TANK 1 AND 4 BOOST PUMPS

note.para: Main Tank 2 or 3 boost pumps are interchangeable with Main Tank 1 or 4 boost pumps.

numlitem.para: With an inoperative Main Tank 1 or 4 Boost Pump, the main tank transfer valves must be verified to be operative.

On the Pilots Overhead Panel, set the FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch to the ON position. On the Fuel System Synoptic display, observe that transfer arrows are displayed between Main Tanks 1 & 2 and Main Tanks 3 & 4.
Observe that Main Tanks 1 & 4 quantity indications are decreasing.
Set the FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch to the OFF position. On the Fuel System Synoptic display, observe that the transfer arrows are no longer displayed between Main Tanks 1 & 2 and Main Tanks 3 & 4.
Manual Override Handle visual verification method:

Cycle the gravity valves using the FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch and visually observe that the Manual Override Handle on both main tank transfer valves cycle to the open and closed position as commanded by FUEL XFER MAIN 1 & 4 switch.
Deactivate the inoperative fuel pump by opening the collaring the appropriate circuit breaker.
Tank 1 Fwd Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 1.
Tank 1 Aft Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 1.
Tank 4 Fwd Boost Pump: P414 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN FWD 4.
Tank 4 Aft Boost Pump: P415 panel, FUEL BOOST PUMP MAIN AFT 4.
